generate.description: Generates default json files which are required for search engine.

arguments./path/to/save: Explicitly specifies path to save generated jsons.

arguments.-h: Print out help information about this command.

config.description: Print info about this program. Reports if indexed files do not exist.

arguments.none: Tries to search for config.json in current dir and in json|jsons subdir.

arguments.-r: Optional. Same as calling without arguments, but searching recursively.

arguments.-d: deletes invalid path from config.json files field

arguments.-h: Print out help information about this command.

find.description: Performs searches for queries from requests.json among indexed documents. The response is written to answers.json in the executable directory.

arguments.none: Tries to search for config.json and requests.json in current dir and in json|jsons subdir.

arguments.-r: Optional. Same as calling without arguments, but searching recursively.

arguments./path/to/config /path/to/requests: Explicitly specifies paths to config.json and requests.json. The order of the arguments does not matter.

arguments.-print: Optional argument. In case of a successful search, asks to print out the received answers in standard output.

arguments.-h: Print out help information about this command.

index.description: Writes all files with .txt extension found (search is recursive) in the specified dir to the list of indexed files in the config.json.

arguments./path/to/resources: Required argument. Document search directory. config.json searched in the current directory and in json|jsons subir.

arguments.-r: Optional. Asks to search config.json recursively.

arguments.-h: Print out help information about this command.

print.description: Print out the content of json file.

arguments./path/to/json: Required argument. Document to print out.
